If I had not made that decision, forget about FAANG, I would still be searching for a job or become a daily wage worker 🙃

@its_me_sourav_1 When I say 90% luck, I mean - birth.

In school, some students used to fail in exams, or get very less marks...

I used to think, they will never be successful...

Now most of them looking after their father's business and earning more than class toppers

It seems, in life 90% is luck, 10% is hard work

@Krishna70284154 😂😂True....

Even I saw those videos...
You know the generation is cooked when random street dancers on youtube & insta are earning more than Scientists, Doctors & Engineers

I don't understand this logic..

My brother pays 30% tax to government. Bought home on loan. If he lose job..no gov will help him

But his apartment watchman don't pay tax, but he got free house from gov, his wife gets free money from gov & free bus rides

are we just their ATMs?

IMO, students from either tier-3 colleges or IITs/NITs/IIITs are intellectually the same...

If tier-3 students (or his parents) were aware of JEE exams in 6th class... they too would have taken IIT coaching from 6th class & joined IITs/IIITs/NITs

It is purely an awareness issue
@Iam_Prathap Exactly.............

@Krishna70284154 I am not blaming anyone...  I am focussing on middle class background

Bill gates or Elon musk come from financially strong background, so they took the risk

If I go & tell my parents that I will resign my job & start a startup

They will definitely won't allow me to take risk

Same situation with many IT guys, as most of us come from middle-class families

Sadly this is the reason why we don't have Indian Google, ChatGPT or Apple etc

We have to
1. Sit for 8 hours in AC rooms
2. Plan which 5-star hotel to go for team lunch

China has 7 million Software engineers
India 6 million
USA 4.4 million
